hedline.hl1: President Offers His Take On Impeachment Reading

abstract.p: Pres Clinton says he has read books about his impeachment but does not plan to write one of his own; makes remark during visit to bookstore in San Jose, Calif (S)

block.p: President Clinton said today during a visit to a bookstore that he had read books about his impeachment but did not plan to write one of his own.

He stopped at Willow Glen Books during a fund-raising visit to the San Jose area and saw a display featuring ''The Breach,'' an account of the impeachment by Peter Baker, a reporter for The Washington Post. But Mr. Clinton said that he did not plan to buy it or read it.

When asked by reporters, Mr. Clinton said that he had read and liked two books about the impeachment -- ''The Hunting of the President,'' by Joe Conason and Gene Lyons, and ''A Vast Conspiracy,'' by Jeffrey Toobin. Both are sympathetic to his position.
President Clinton did buy two books in the shop, ''The Bear and the Dragon,'' by Tom Clancy and ''Spirit Matters,'' by Michael Lerner.
